text.section:
The State may recover grant funds paid under this subtitle if, within 30 years after completion of a project, the property for which funds have been paid:
is sold or transferred to a person that:
would not qualify as an applicant under this subtitle; or
is not approved as a transferee by the Board of Public Works; or
ceases to be a residential child care program.

The State may recover from the:
transferor;
transferee; or
owner of a property that has ceased to be a residential child care program.

The State may recover the sum of:
an amount that equals the value of the project property at the time of the recovery multiplied by a fraction:
the numerator of which is the amount of the State funds for the project; and
the denominator of which is the total eligible cost of the project; and
all costs and reasonable attorneys' fees incurred in the recovery proceedings.
The Board of Public Works may waive the State's right of recovery under this subtitle for good cause.
